Shareholder Return

Shareholder Return

Shareholder Return

SK Networks maintains a transparent dividend policy and take various measures to enhance shareholder value, including treasury stock buybacks and retirements.

Dividend Policy

Financial resources for dividends will be divided into business profits and investment returns to ensure transparent calculations. A significant portion of dividends from business profits will be paid out as regular dividends in the first half of the year, while interim dividends will be introduced to distribute a fixed percentage of business profits and investment returns in the second half.

Treasury Stock Management

All treasury stocks, except those designated for investment purposes, will be retired immediately after the buyback.

Dividends

( Unit : KRW 1 million )
The table provides dividend details and consists of categories, 2023, 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019.
Category 2023 2022 2021 2020 2019
Total Dividends 40,506 26,250 26,237 26,237 28,881
Net Income (Separate) 28,772 6,090 55,843 3,777 - 85,962
Dividend Payout Ratio 141% 431% 47% 695% - 34%
Dividend Yield 2.5% 3.0% 2.4% 2.5% 20%

* As of April 1, 2024 / Common Share

Treasury Stock Buyback (excluding the exercise of appraisal rights)

2023. 03. 14 ~ 2023. 09. 21

  • Repurchase of Treasury Common Shares: 19,962,158 shares (8.5% of issued common shares)

2020. 03. 05 ~ 2020. 06. 04

  • Repurchase of Treasury Common Shares: 22,000,000 shares (8.9% of issued common shares)
  • Repurchase of Treasury Preferred Shares: 10,500 shares (9.2% of issued preferred shares)

2017. 08 .11 ~ 2017. 10. 24

  • Repurchase of Treasury Common Shares: 7,622,000 shares (3.1% of issued common shares)
Treasury Stock Retirement

2024. 03. 05

  • 14,500,363 treasury common shares (6.1% of issued common shares) were retired.

2023. 04. 05

  • 12,409,382 treasury common shares (5.0% of issued common shares) were retired.
